visiannot.tools.ToolsImage¶

Module with functions for loading image and video files

Summary¶

Functions¶

visiannot.tools.ToolsImage.getDataVideo(path)

Loads video data with openCV

visiannot.tools.ToolsImage.readImage(path)

Reads an image with openCV

visiannot.tools.ToolsImage.transformImage(im)

Changes the order of an image channels in order to get RGB color, may reverse the first and second axis (in order to transform shape to ).

API¶

Functions¶

visiannot.tools.ToolsImage.getDataVideo(path)[source]¶

Loads video data with openCV

Parameters

path (str) – path to the video file

Returns

  • data_video (cv2.VideoCapture)

  • nframes (int) – number of frames in the video

  • fps (int or float) - frame rate of the video

  • date_time (datetime.datetime) – beginning date-time of the video file (this information must be provided in the name of the video file, see ToolsDateTime.getFileDatetimeString())

Author

Raphael Weber

visiannot.tools.ToolsImage.readImage(path)[source]¶

Reads an image with openCV

Parameters

path (str) – path to the image file

Returns

RGB image array of shape

Return type

numpy array

Author

Raphael Weber

visiannot.tools.ToolsImage.transformImage(im, RGB_combination='BGR', flag_transpose=True)[source]¶

Changes the order of an image channels in order to get RGB color, may reverse the first and second axis (in order to transform shape to ).

Particularly useful to display images retrieved with openCV. Indeed, openCV returns images of shape with BGR color.

Parameters

  • im (numpy array) – image array of shape , where third axis is a 3-channel color

  • RGB_combination (str) – order of the color channel (as with openCV)

  • flag_transpose (bool) – specify if first axis and second axis must be reversed

Returns

image array of shape where third axis is RGB color

Return type

numpy array

If im is not a numpy array or is not a 3D array, then the output is im.

Author

Raphael Weber
